div.p: ANTONIO: Before we get started with Unit 2, let's run through a quick review.
ANTONIO: In Unit 1, we looked at the formula for lifestyle related health problems.
ANTONIO: We learned our biology plus our choices determine whether or not we'll develop alcoholism or addiction. Biology sets the trigger level, but our choices make the difference.
ANTONIO: We also learned that the definition of a standard drink is .6 ounces of pure alcohol (which is a little more than one half of an ounce).
ANTONIO: The "0-1-2-3 Guidelines" for preventing health and impairment problems mean having no more than 1 drink per hour; no more than 2 daily;
no more than 3 drinks on any given day; and again, 0 is the only low-risk choice for those with alcoholism.
ANTONIO: In this unit, we're going to learn more about how our choices affect us. To get started, I'd like you to take a few minutes to answer some questions.
ANTONIO: Now, I want to emphasize, your answers are private. And the more honest you are with yourself, the more you will benefit from this activity.
